description: Details required for Condition 5 (Site Logistic Plan) of planning permission 19/02048/FUL (Change of use from car storage (use class Sui Generis) to Residential and the Erection of 3 storey, part 4 storey residential development comprising of 9 self-contained residential units)
decision_conditions: Insufficient information has been provided in regard to Condition 5 (Site Logistic Plan) of planning permission 19/02048/FUL.1) No details of contractor parking arrangements are provided. It is simply stated that there will be no parking provision on site.2) No swept path (tracking) drawing has been provided to show how vehicles will safely enter and egress from the site, given the lack of turning space.3) No details of strategic access (haul routes) have been provided.4) A strengthened vehicle crossover for construction vehicles to prevent damage to the public highway is required. A commitment to arranging with RBK Highways for this to be installed at the applicant's expense is required.The Site Logistics Plan provided would therefore would fail to protect the amenities of the surrounding residential occupiers and safeguard highway safety and the free flow of traffic, in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.
